link:labelLink.link:label: Business Segment

The BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] and the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy [BasBusSgHrchy] have been designed to tabularize the portions of an organizational chart that is reflected in the business transactions as structural units e.g. business unit, department, cost center and project).The fields within the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] are used to capture the individual organizational unit represented by each box on an organizational diagram.
Business Segment Code
Code for each business segment.
Business Segment Name
Name of the business segment.
Business Segment Reference Level
Relative level of the segment, with 1 being the consolidated level and the numbers increasing through the lower levels of the organizational chart.
Segment Business Organization Type Name
Indicates the name of the organization type (e.g. department, cost centre).
Business Segment Hierarchy

The fields in the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy [BasBusSgHrchy] are used to capture the relationships between the individual organization units. The table assumes a one to one relationship and captures the data necessary to consolidate transactions occurring for child level organizational units into higher level organizational structures (for example, business unit to division).
Business Segment Hierarchy Parent Code Business Segment
Code for the parent business segment.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Business Segment Hierarchy Child Code Business Segment
Code for the child business segment.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Employee
Contains the personnel information of the employee in an independent accounting unit.
Employee ID
Unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Employee Code

Code for the employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone has part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID [EmpId] in this table. The part time status will be reflected in Employee_Type_Code [EmpTypCd].
Employee Name
The name of the employee.
Employee Inactive Flag
Indicates whether one employee is active or inactive.An employee can become inactive due to various reasons (e.g taking a sabbatical).
Employee Type Code
Code for the employee type. EXAMPLE 004 is an on-the job employee, 005 is a retired employee, 006 is a deceased employee, 007 is a part-time employee.
Employee Type Name
Name of the employee type. EXAMPLE Employed, retired, probation, part-time.
Employee Department Code Business Segment
Code for department rosters. EXAMPLE The department name is IT department, the code is 0018. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Employee Job Title
Job title of the person in an accounting unit.EXAMPLE Accounting manager.
Employee Academic Degree
Highest academic degree acquired.EXAMPLE Doctor, Master.
Employee Employment Date
Employment date of the employee.
Employee Termination Date
Termination date of the employee from which the labor contract was no longer valid, or the employee no longer works in this department.
Employee User ID User
System user ID associated with the employee. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
User
Contains the user information of accounting and/or ERP system.
User ID

Unique identifier for individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system.Typically auto-generated by the system.This field is used to join information in this table to other tables based on fields such as Created_User_ID, Last_Modified_User_ID, Approved_User_ID and Posted_User_ID.
User Active Status
Indicates whether the status of the user is active or inactive.A user can become inactive due to retirement, dismissal or termination, etc.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
User Status Modified Date
Modified date of the user's activation or termination status.
User Name
Name of the user.
User Job Title
Job title of the person in the system.EXAMPLE System manager.
User Department Code Business Segment
Code for department rosters.EXAMPLE The department name is IT department, the code is 0018.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
User Role Responsibility
Free-form description of the individual's functional role or primary responsibility.EXAMPLE Responsibility related to managing the information of AP in the system.
Customer Type
Contains detailed descriptions of the customer type.
Customer Type ID
Unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Customer Type Code

Code for the customer type.EXAMPLE 004 is a platinum customer, 005 is a gold customer, 006 is a silver customer. Customer_Type_Code [CustTypCd] and Customer_Type_Name [CustTypNm] are not necessarily related.
Customer Type Name
Name of the type categorized by the customer attributes.EXAMPLE Platinum customer, gold customer, silver customer.
Customer Type Parent Customer Type ID Customer Type
Unique identifier for the parent customer type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Type_ID [CustTypId] in the BAS_Customer_Type [BasCustTyp] table.
Customer
Contains essential and generic information of the customers.
Customer Account ID
Unique identifier for the customer. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Customer Account Number
Number of the customer. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
Customer Account Name
Name of the customer.
Customer Abbreviation
Abbreviation of the customer's name.
Customer Parent Customer ID Customer
Unique identifier for the parent customer.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
Customer Corresponding Supplier ID Supplier

Unique identifier for the corresponding supplier in cases where the customer is also a supplier.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table. Otherwise, set NULL.
Customer Customer Type ID Customer Type
Unique identifier for the customer type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Type_ID [CustTypId] in the BAS_Customer_Type [BasCustTyp] table.
Customer TIN
Customer's tax identification number.This number is usually generated by a tax regulator.
Customer Inactive Date
Date when the customer was declared inactive.A customer can become inactive due to exceeding their credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy.
Customer Transaction Credit Limit
Per invoice credit limit established for this customer.
Customer Total Credit Limit
Credit limit for this customers total outstanding balance.
Customer Terms Discount Percentage
Discount percentage the customer can take if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to a decimal place.EXAMPLE 10 % is 0.10.
Customer Terms Discount Days
Number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms.Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places.EXAMPLE 10 days are 10.
Customer Terms Due Days
Default number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.

Physical Address
Address Physical Street Address1
Line 1 of the street address.
Address Physical Street Address2
Line 2 of the street address.
Address Physical City Name
City name of this address.
Address Physical State Province Code

Address Physical Postal Code
Zip or postal code of this address.
Address Physical Country Code
The country code of this address (in accordance with ISO 3166-1).

Billing Address
Address Billing Street Address1
Line 1 of the street address.
Address Billing Street Address2
Line 2 of the street address.
Address Billing City Name
City name of this address.
Address Billing State Province Code
The state or province of this address (in accordance with ISO 3166-2).
Address Billing Postal Code
Zip or postal code of this address.
Address Billing Country Code
The country code of this address (in accordance with ISO 3166-1).
Primary Contact
Primary contact information.
Primary Contact
Contact Primary Name
Name of the contact.
Contact Primary Phone
The phone number of the contact.
Contact Primary Email
The email address of the contact.
Created
Information about the data that was created into the system.
Created
Created User ID User
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Created Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Created Time
The time of activity.
Approved
Information about the data was approved within the system.
Approved
Approved User ID User
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Approved Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Approved Time
The time of activity.
Last Modified
Information about the data was last modified within the system.
Last Modified
Last Modified User ID User
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Modified Last Date
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Modified Last Time
The time of activity.
Supplier Type
Contains detailed descriptions of the supplier type.
Supplier Type ID
Unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Supplier Type Code
Code for the supplier type.EXAMPLE 004 is preferred suppliers, 005 is key suppliers, 006 is common suppliers.
Supplier Type Name
Name of the type categorized by the supplier attributes.EXAMPLE Preferred supplier, key supplier, common supplier.
Supplier Type Parent Supplier Type ID Supplier Type

Unique identifier for the parent supplier type.EXAMPLE Raw material supplier is a parent type of iron supplier.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID [SuplTypId] in the BAS_Supplier_Type [BasSuplTyp] table.
Supplier
Contains essential and generic information of the suppliers.
Supplier Account ID
Unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Supplier Account Number
Number of the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied.This number is usually generated by manual input or is generated by the system.
Supplier Account Name
Name of the supplier.
Supplier Abbreviation
Abbreviation form of the supplier's name.
Supplier Parent Supplier ID Supplier
Unique identifier for the parent supplier.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Supplier Corresponding Customer ID Customer

Unique identifier for the corresponding customer in cases where the supplier is also a customer.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table. Otherwise, set NULL.
Supplier Supplier Type ID Supplier Type
Unique identifier for the supplier type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID [SuplTypId] in the BAS_Supplier_Type [BasSuplTyp] table.
Supplier TIN
Supplier's tax identification number.This number is usually generated by the tax regulator.
Supplier Group
Supplier group assignments when the organization segments the suppliers.
Supplier Inactive Date
Date when the supplier was declared inactive.A supplier can become inactive due to exceeding their credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy.
Supplier Transaction Credit Limit
Per invoice credit limit established for this supplier.
Supplier Total Credit Limit
Credit limit for the total outstanding balance approved for the supplier.
Supplier Terms Discount Percentage
Discount percentage the supplier can provide if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to a decimal place.EXAMPLE 10 % is 0.10.
Supplier Terms Discount Days
Number of days from the invoice date that the supplier allows the customer to take advantage of discounted terms.Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places.EXAMPLE 10 days is 10.
Supplier Terms Due Days
Number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.

Chart Of Accounts

Contains the information about GL accounts, including name, description, type and hierarchy. This table is level 1. When it is cross-referred by other table(s), consistency shall apply. For example, in this table, the value of GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] is 101, the value of GL_Account_Name [GlAcntNm] is cash, and the value of Balance_Debit_Or_Credit is D. If the value of GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in GL_Trial_Balance [GlTrialBal] table is 101, then the Amount corresponding with cash account (101) must be debit.
Accounts Of Chart GL Account Number
Number of the GL account.
Accounts Of Chart GL Account Name
Name of the GL account.
Accounts Of Chart GL Account Description
Label or description associated with the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr].
Accounts Of Chart Financial Statement Caption
Financial statement caption that represents a related group of accounts.EXAMPLE Cash and cash equivalents, AP, cost of sales.The caption can be at the trial balance level.
Accounts Of Chart Account Type
Type of account.EXAMPLE Assets, liabilities, equity, revenues, expenses.
Accounts Of Chart Account Subtype
Subtype of the account.EXAMPLE Current assets are the subtype of assets.
Accounts Of Chart Account Hierarchy
Corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy.EXAMPLE 1 is assets, 2 is the account subtype current assets.
Chart Of Accounts Parent GL Account Number Chart Of Accounts

Number of the parent account in an account hierarchy.This is provided to allow more than the predefined levels of the hierarchy in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.When Parent_GL_Account_Number [ParGlAcntNr] is the highest level, its value can be set to the default value (e.g. set to NULL).Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Accounts Of Chart Balance Debit Or Credit Code

Indicates whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating D or C, where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.
Accounts Of Chart Active Flag
Indicates whether the GL account is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Accounting Period

Contains information related to the accounting period, including corresponding fiscal year, beginning date and ending date. The table captures the time range within a specific reporting period and year, in which business transactions and entries are accumulated into financial statements and other reports.
Period Accounting Fiscal Year
Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.
Accounting Period
Accounting period in which the calendar date occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.
Accounting Period BEG Date
Calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.
Accounting Period Ending Date
Calendar ending date of the current accounting period.
Journal Entry Type
Contains information relevant to the GL journal entry type (e.g. cash receipts, cash disbursements).
Journal Entry Type Code
Code for the journal entry type.EXAMPLE 004 is a cash receipt entry, 005 is a cash disbursement entry, 006 is a non-cash entry.
Journal Entry Type Name

Name of the journal entry type.This is usually categorized by business to satisfy an internal control need and/or to facilitate sorting and querying.EXAMPLE Journal entries can be classified based on whether the transaction involves cash. In this case, there can be a cash receipt entry, cash disbursement entry and non-cash entry of adjusting that is the recording of interest revenue earned and wages payable, estimation that is the recording depreciation, and bad-debt expenses, and/or correction that makes entries to counteract the effects of errors found in the GL.
Journal Entry Type Abbreviation
Abbreviation of the journal entry type.
Type Entry Journal Active Flag
Indicates whether the JE type is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Bill Type

The information of the bill type (e.g. bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note, check). Bills are frequently used in the business cycle of sales and purchase, as evidence of debt, payment and/or settlement instrument.
Bill Type Code
Code for the bill type.EXAMPLE 004 is bank draft, 005 is promissory note, 006 is check.
Bill Type Name
Name of the bill type.EXAMPLE Bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note and check.
Type Bill Active Flag
Indicates whether the bill type is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Settlement Method

Contains information on methods used to settle transactions. Businesses can adopt various methods to settle transactions and transfer money, especially in sales and purchase activities. Typical settlement methods include cash settlements, issuing bills, using credit cards, bank remittances and bank collections.
Settlement Method Code

Code for the settlement method.Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money.EXAMPLE 001 for cash, 002 for bills, 003 for credit card, 004 for remittance, 005 for bank collection.
Settlement Method Name
Name of the settlement method.EXAMPLE Cash settlement, issuing bills, credit card, bank remittance, bank collection.
Method Settlement Active Flag
Indicates whether the settlement method is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Currency
Contains the information of the currency.
Currency Code
Code for the currency (in accordance with ISO 4217).
Currency Name
Name of the currency in the accounting and/or ERP system.
Currency Minor Unit

Unit of recorded value that is a division of the respective unit of currency.Minor unit shows the decimal relationship between such a unit and the currency itself (in accordance with ISO 4217). Number 0 means that there is no minor unit for that currency. Numbers 1, 2, 3, etc. signify a ratio of 10:1, 100:1, 1 000:1, etc., respectively.EXAMPLE The US cent is a one hundredth part of the US dollar. The GB penny is a one hundredth part of the pound sterling. The minor unit number for both is 2.
Currency Active Flag
Indicates whether Currency_Code [CurCd] is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Measurement Unit
Contains information of the measurement unit (UOM) used in the modules of GL, SAL, PUR, INV and PPE.
Unit Measurement UOM Code
Code of the measurement unit.
Unit Measurement UOM Name
Name of the measurement unit for measuring the quantity of the material, etc.
Unit Measurement UOM Abbreviation
Abbreviation of the measurement unit's name.EXAMPLE Kilogram is kg, square metre is sq.m.
Unit Measurement Active Flag
Indicates whether the UOM_Code [UomCd] is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Payment Term

Contains the details of the payment term, which is applied and referenced in the PUR and SAL modules. The payment term refers to the condition of a sale/purchase agreement and is related to how the customer will pay (type of credit instrument), and especially how much time is allowed for payment (credit period) and discount (cash discount and discount period).
Payment Term Code

Code for the payment term.EXAMPLE Terms of 2/10, net 60 are quoted. This means that customers have 60 days from the invoice date to pay the full amount. However, if payment is made within 10 days, a 2 % cash discount can be taken.
Payment Term Name
The full name of the payment term.
Payment Term Line Number
Number of the lines according to the Payment_Term_Code [PayTermCd] value.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Payment Term Line Description
Detailed description of the payment term's line.EXAMPLE Payment due date, discount days, discount percentage.
Term Payment Active Flag
Indicates whether the payment term is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Project

Contains the detailed information related to the project (e.g. construction project, government or business-funded research project). Projects are commonly administrated separately and could be subject to being audit in accordance with regulatory and/or managerial requirements. The audit of a project is a thorough examination of the management, execution, methodology, procedures, records, budgets, expenditures, and the degree of completion. It is referenced in several modules including GL, AR, AP and INV.
Project ID
Unique identifier for the project.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Project Code
Code of the project.
Project Name
Name of the project related to operation and administration.
Project Beginning Date
Beginning date of the project.
Project Ending Date
Ending date of the project.
Project Active Flag
Indicates whether the project is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Bank Account
Contains the details of a bank account.
Bank Account Number
Number of the account opened in an institution (e.g. bank, financial institution, settlement centre).ISO 13616-2 is recommended if applicable.
Bank Account Name
Name of the account opened in an institution (e.g. bank, financial institution, settlement centre).
Account Bank Code
Code for the financial institution (in accordance with ISO 9362 or ISO 17442).ISO 17442 is preferred. One reason is that the bank branch identifier will not change due to location movement.
Account Bank Name
Full name of the institution (e.g. bank, financial institution, settlement centre).
Account Bank Branch Code
Code for the institution's branch.
Account Bank Branch Name
Full name of the institution's branch.
Account Bank Branch Country Code
Country code where the branch is physically located (in accordance with ISO 3166-1).
Account Bank Branch Region
Sub-region within a country.EXAMPLE A state in the US, a province in Canada.
Account Bank Active Flag
Indicates whether the bank account is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Tax Regulatory
Contains regulatory information related to taxes, including regulator country, region, name and role.
Regulatory Tax Regulator Code
Code of the regulator or jurisdiction.
Regulatory Tax Regulator Country Code
Country code where the regulator is located (in accordance with ISO 3166-1).
Regulatory Tax Regulator Region
Sub-region within a country.EXAMPLE A state in the US, a province in Canada.
Regulatory Tax Regulator Name
Name of the regulator for which tax is withheld or accrued.
Regulatory Tax Regulator Role
Role of the regulator, whether federal, regional or local.
Tax Regulatory Regulator Payable Account Number Chart Of Accounts
GL account used to reflect the amounts payable to the regulator.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Tax Regulatory Regulator Accrual Account Number Chart Of Accounts
GL account used to reflect the accruals due to the regulator.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Tax Regulatory Regulator Expense Account Number Chart Of Accounts
GL account used to reflect the expenses related to the regulator.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Regulatory Tax Regulator ID
ID assigned/generated by the regulator for the reporting organization to the regulator.
Tax Regulatory Regulator Reporting ORG Business Segment
Code for the reporting organization.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Regulatory Tax Regulator Active Flag
Indicates whether the Regulator_Code [RgltrCd] is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Tax Type

Contains detailed information on tax types used by the business. The tables in AR, SAL, AP and PUR modules contain 4 tax types, which can meet the requirements in most cases of the business. Tax types could be tax in country level, state level, county level or in local level, or could be tax related to a transaction (e.g. sales tax, value added tax, tariff).
Tax Type Code
Code used to refer to this tax type, used as a key or cross-reference in files.EXAMPLE 004 is the income tax, 005 is the tariff, 006 is the value added tax.
Type Tax Name
Name of the tax type.EXAMPLE Income tax, tariff, value added tax.
Tax Type Regulator Code Tax Regulatory
Code for the regulator for this tax.Shall match the Regulator_Code [RgltrCd] in the BAS_Tax_Regulatory [BasTaxRgltry] table.
Tax Type Description
Description of the tax type.
Type Tax Code Description
Description of the tax code, which is a sub-division of the tax type.EXAMPLE Lower percentage applicable for common goods.
Type Tax Percentage
Default percentage for this combination of tax type and tax code.Can use the Extracted_Date [ExtractedDt] from the BAS_Profile [BasProfile] table.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Customized Account Segment

An Account Segment is a customized file item, which includes the information of the customized account segments that are not fixed account segments and no other table contains their description information (e.g. region type). This table is used together with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Value [BasCstmzdAccValue].
Customized Account Segment Code

Code for the customized account segment that audit data need to be used.This does not include the fixed account segment having been identified.EXAMPLE Unlike customer, budget information is not included in the BAS module as an individual table, therefore budget can be identified as a customized account segment.
Customized Account Segment Name
Customized account segment name that audit data need to be used.EXAMPLE Budget records, planned revenue, expenditure.
Segment Customized Account Description

Customized account segment description that audit data need to be used.EXAMPLE Budget can be described as the annual plan of aggregated fiscal revenue and expenditure for a state, which is verified and approved through legal procedures.
Segment Customized Account Encoding Rule

Encoding rules of the value of a customized account segment.If the encoding rule has a hierarchy feature, each level is separated by "-".EXAMPLE Budget (with a 1-digit code, e.g. 1) can be subdivided into financial budget (with a 2-digit code, e.g. 01) and construction budget (with a 2-digit code, e.g. 05), with the financial budget containing budgeted revenue (with a 2-digit code, e.g. 03) and budgeted expenditure (with a 2-digit code, e.g. 04), which are the third-level segments. In this case, the Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule [CstmzdAccEncRule] is 1-2-2.
Segment Account Customized Hierarchy Flag
Whether or not the table value has a hierarchy feature.EXAMPLE 1 is yes, 0 is no.
Segment Account Customized Active Flag
Indicates whether the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code [CstmzdAccSgCd] is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Customized Account Value
Contains the information from the customized account segment value.
Customized Account Value Code
Code for the customized account segment value.If the Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule [CstmzdAccEncRule] is 1-2-2, the corresponding budget-financial budget-budgeted expenditure is 10104.
Customized Account Value Customized Account Segment Code Customized Account Segment
Associated with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg] table.Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code [CstmzdAccSgCd] in the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg] table.
Customized Account Value Name
Name of the account segment value of each file.EXAMPLE Budget-financial budget-budgeted expenditure.
Customized Account Value Description
Detailed description of the account segment value.

Profile

Contains industry and software version information. This table contains information related to the profile of the data being collected. For example, when we extract the financial data of 2016 from an auditee using SAP XXX ERP System in 2017.1.16, there should be a record with the Profile_Name [ProfileNm] "XXX_2016", Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] "2016", Developer_Name [DvlprNm] "SAP", Software_Name [SftwNm] "SAP_S/4", Software_Version [SftwVers] "2.0", Functional_Currency "CNY", Standard_Version [StdVers] "ISO 21378", Extracted_Date [ExtractedDt] "2017-01-16".
Profile Number
Number of the current data collection.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Profile Name
Name of the current data collection.
Profile Fiscal Year
Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs.The date shall be shown as YYYY-MM-DD in the extended format. The YYYY indicates a four-digit year (in accordance with ISO 8601-1).
Profile Accounting Entity
Legal name of an accounting entity.
Profile Industry
Corresponding industry name under a superior sector code.
Profile Developer Name
Name of accounting and/or ERP system software developer.
Profile Software Name
Name of accounting and/or ERP system software products.
Profile Software Version
Accounting and/or ERP system software version.
Profile Functional Currency Code Currency
Functional or group currency used in accounting and/or ERP system software (in accordance with ISO 4217).
Profile Standard Version
Standard issuing number of the standard(s) with which the current output files are consistent.EXAMPLE ISO 21378.
Profile Extracted Date
Date of the data extraction.
Profile Time Zone

Indicates the difference between the local time and UTC of a day.The representation of the difference can be expressed in hours and minutes, or hours only. The Time_Zone [TmZone] shall be shown as hh:mm in the extended format (in accordance with ISO 8601-1).EXAMPLE Newfoundland's time zone is -03:30, Beijing's time zone is +08:00.

Trial Balance

Contains all the ledger account balance information of the ADCS. The GL_Trial_Balance [GlTrialBal] file shall contain the ending balances at a point in time. Balance Trial Gl Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Balance_As_Of_Date [BalAsOfDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Trial Gl Balance As Of Date
Date through which the provided balance reflects account activity.EXAMPLE If a report is run for activity through 2014-12-31 on 2015-01-22, the date recorded will be 2014-12-31.

Gl Header

Contains all of the journal entry details for each transaction (e.g. associated journal entry ID, associated account number, debits or credits associated with the journal entry line). This table should be at the journal entry line level.
Header Gl Journal ID
Unique identifier for each journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Header Gl Journal Number
Number of the journal entry (e.g. including serial number, document type, date).
Gl Header Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Effective_Date [EffectiveDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Gl Header Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Effective_Date [EffectiveDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Header Gl Effective Date

Date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or created.This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date.EXAMPLE If the user wants to see the financial results for the period ending March 5, 20XX, the journal entry may be created on any day during the open period and be assigned to the period ending March 5, 20XX.
Gl Journal Entry Header Description
Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.
Gl Header Source Code Gl Source

Code for the source from which the journal entry originated.EXAMPLE Sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, spreadsheet.Shall match the Source_Code [SrcCd] in the GL_Source [GlSrc] table.

Gl Details
Details Gl Journal Line Number
Number of the line within a journal entry.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Gl Details Journal Entry Type Code Journal Entry Type
Code for the journal entry type.Shall match the JE_Type_Code [JeTypCd] in the BAS_Journal_Entry_Type [BasJrnEntryTyp] table.
Details Gl Journal Entry Line Description
Description of the individual line within the journal entry.
Details Gl Credit Debit Indicator
Indicates whether the amount is a credit or a debit.EXAMPLE C is credit, D is debit.
Gl Details GL Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] used in the AS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
Details Gl Bill Number

Number of the bill.A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrusts the drawee at sight. A specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Gl Details Bill Type Code Bill Type
Type of bill.EXAMPLE Bank drafts, promissory notes, checks.Shall match the Bill_Type_Code [BillTypCd] in the BAS_Bill_Type [BasBillTyp] table.
Details Gl Bill Date
Date of the bill.
Details Gl Quantity
Quantity of items referenced in the journal entry line.When the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] is for inventories or fixed assets, this field is effective. If not, this field is NULL.
Gl Details UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the physical measurement scale for the inventory and PPE referred to as a "unit of measurement (UOM)".Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Details Gl Unit Price

Per unit price of the inventory or PPE.This field is associated with Quantity and Amount.EXAMPLE If the account is inventory or PPE, Quantity can be multiplied by Unit_Price [UnitPrice] to get total line Amount.
Gl Details Settlement Method Code Settlement Method

Code value or indicator of the settlement method used for cash receipt from customers (i.e. sales) and cash payment to suppliers (i.e. purchase).EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Details Gl Reversal Indicator

Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed.EXAMPLE 1 is the entry is a reversal, 2 is the entry is being reversed, an empty (" ") is none of the above or system-generated indicators.
Details Gl Reversal Journal ID
When the Reversal_Indicator [RevInd] = 1, this field identifies the Journal_ID [JrnId] of the entry being reversed.
Details Gl Cancellation Sign
Sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted.EXAMPLE 0 is entry is not cancelled, 1 is entry is cancelled.
Gl Details Account Segment Employee Employee

Fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers).The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID [EmpId].Shall match the Employee_ID [EmpId] in the BAS_Employee [BasEmp] table through GL_Account_Segment [GlAcntSg].
Gl Details Account Segment Project Project

Fixed account segment, recording information related to a project.EXAMPLE Construction projects that require separate accounting.The value of this field stored is Project_ID [ProjId].Shall match the Project_ID [ProjId] in the BAS_Project [BasProj] table through GL_Account_Segment [GlAcntSg].
Gl Details Account Segment Bank Account Bank Account

Fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts.The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number [BankAcntNr]. More information about a certain bank account can be obtained from the BAS_Bank_Account [BasBankAcnt] table.Shall match the Bank_Account_Number [BankAcntNr] in the BAS_Bank_Account [BasBankAcnt] table through GL_Account_Segment [GlAcntSg].

Gl Source

Contains additional information about the sources provided in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table. Each source shall include a description of the ERP system or accounting package, from which the data is extracted, and information related to the business process the data represents.

Account Segment

Contains the code and name for the account segment, as well as the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] to which the account segment is related. Account Segment provides additional information for particular GL_Accounts (e.g. the AR contains the information regarding supplier, customer, employee, and project). Such information would be treated as an Account Segment below A/R, thus resulting in a lengthy account structure. The Account Segment structure is therefore defined as a set to record related information, which efficiently stops account names and numbers from becoming too long and too complex. Account Segment is more flexible to capture the complicated information.Some of the most frequently used account segments (e.g. project, employee, bank account) are defined as fixed fields in tables, such as GL_Details [GlDtls]. These segments are called "fixed account segments" in the document. Fixed account segments and other customized account segments are covered in this table.
Segment Gl GL Account Number
Number of the GL account. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Gl Account Segment Number

Number of the Account_Segment.Case 1: If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by the Account_Segment_Name [AcntSgNm] of the record.Case 2: If the value of this field is 5, the record is used to explain the No.5 field of Account_Segment_X, named Account_Segment_5 in the tables, such as GL_Details [GlDtls].This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Gl Account Segment Name

Name of the Account_Segment.Case 1: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] of the record is 0, the field contains the name of a fixed account segment, such as Account_Segment_Employee [AcntSgEmp].Case 2: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] of the record is 5, the field value should be the name of a customized account segment, such as welfare expenditure.
Segment Account Gl Corresponding File

Table corresponding to the account segment. Case 1: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] of the record is 0, the field contains the table name corresponding to the fixed account segment, such as BAS_Employee [BasEmp] for Account_Segment_Employee [AcntSgEmp].Case 2: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] is larger than 0, and no other table besides BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg] contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg].Case 3: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] is larger than 0, and there is a table containing the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be the table's name, such as BAS_Customer [BasCust].
Gl Account Segment Description
Detailed description of the Account_Segment_Name [AcntSgNm].
Gl Account Segment Customized Account Segment Code Customized Account Segment
Code for the customized account segment.Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code [CstmzdAccSgCd] in the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg] table.
Account Period Balance

Contains the cumulative total and balance of accounts in each accounting period, facilitating the calculation of beginning, ending balance, duration amounts and quantity, thus reflecting information and changes in GL more intuitively. In this table, the quantity can serve different regulatory and managerial purposes. For example, subledgers of inventory and PPE may not be covered in some auditees' systems. In this case, we can record the cumulative total and balance of quantity of inventory or PPE in this table. This is a well-established practice in some countries, like France and China. Countries can choose to use GL_Trial_Balance [GlTrialBal] or GL_Accounts_Period_Balance [GlAcntPerBal] or both, depending on their customary practice, regulatory and managerial requirements.

Number of the GL account.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Period Account Gl Ending Balance Indicator
Ending balance direction for the account, which indicates whether the ending balance is debit or credit.EXAMPLE C is credit, D is debit.

Open Account Receivable

Contains details regarding all open, unpaid or unresolved customer transactions as of a specified date. Each row in this table represents the balance expected from the customer for one uniquely identifiable transaction. This data should be at the summary level (by invoice), not at the detailed level (by invoice line item). The sum total of the transaction amounts as of the specified date shall reconcile to the total AR amount in the GL as of the same date.
Receivable Account Open Transaction ID
Unique identifier for the transaction of an open AR that includes invoice and cash received.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Open Account Receivable Invoice ID Invoice Generated

Unique identifier for the invoice, from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if the adjustment is at the customer (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the SAL_Invoices_Generated [SalInvoiGen] table.
Open Account Receivable Customer Account ID Customer

Unique identifier for the customer from whom payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
Open Account Receivable Sales Contract ID Sales Contract

Unique identifier for the sales contract from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if there is no transaction related to Sales_Contract_ID [SalContrId]. Otherwise shall match the Sales_Contract_ID [SalContrId] in the SAL_Contracts [SalContr] table.
Receivable Account Open Project ID

Unique identifier for the project, from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if no transaction is related to Project_ID [ProjId]. Otherwise shall match the Project_ID [ProjId] in the BAS_Project [BasProj] table.
Open Account Receivable Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Transaction_Date [TrDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Open Account Receivable Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Transaction_Date [TrDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Receivable Account Open Transaction Date
Date of the transaction, regardless of the date when the transaction is created.This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.
Open Account Receivable Journal ID Gl Details
Unique identifier for journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Journal_ID [JrnId] in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table.
Receivable Account Open Transaction Due Date

Date when the payment is due from the customer.Not all transactions will have a due date. May be set to NULL if there is no due date (e.g. for credit memos). Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.
Receivable Account Open Reference Number
Number of an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check number, wire transfer number, original document ID.
Receivable Account Open Reference Date
Date on an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check date, wire transfer date.
Receivable Account Open Remark
Free-form text description.
Receivable Account Open Grouping Code
Code for grouping related items for different purposes.

Unique identifier for the customer from whom payment is received or to whom credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
Cash Received Sales Contract ID Sales Contract

Unique identifier for the sales contract from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if there is no transaction related to Sales_Contract_ID [SalContrId].Otherwise shall match the Sales_Contract_ID [SalContrId] in the SAL_Contracts [SalContr] table.
Cash Received Project ID Project

Unique identifier for the project, from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if no transaction is related to Project_ID [ProjId]. Otherwise shall match the Project_ID [ProjId] in the BAS_Project [BasProj] table.
Cash Received Journal ID Gl Details
Unique identifier for journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Journal_ID [JrnId] in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table.
Cash Received Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Receipt_Date [RcptDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Cash Received Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Receipt_Date [RcptDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Received Cash Receipt Date
Receipt date of the account receivable by the customer.EXAMPLE The received date of a check, wire transfer and cash.
Cash Received Settlement Method Code Settlement Method

Code value or indicator for the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer.EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Received Cash Reference Number
Number of an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check number, wire transfer number, original document ID.
Received Cash Reference Date
Date on an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check date, wire transfer date.
Received Cash Amount Credit Debit Indicator
Indicates whether the amount is a credit or a debit.EXAMPLE C is credit, D is debit.
Received Cash Remark
Free-form text description.
Cash Received GL Debit Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Cash Received GL Credit Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

AR Cash Application

Contains information of all cash receipts applied against the invoice during the period under review. The file will record each application of cash receipt to an invoice. For example, if a cash receipt was applied to three invoices, there will be three records for that receipt, one for each of the invoices to which the cash was applied. In the context of this process, cash means any type of receipt received including checks and wire transfers and cash.
Cash AR Application ID
Unique identifier for the application of cash from a receipt to each invoice.Typically auto-generated by the system.
AR Cash Application Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the AR_Application_Date [ArAplDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
AR Cash Application Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the AR_Application_Date [ArAplDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Cash AR Application Date
Date of the cash application transaction, regardless of the date when the transaction was created.
AR Cash Application Customer Account ID Customer

Unique identifier for the customer from whom payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
AR Cash Application Receipt ID AR Cash Received
Unique identifier for the transactional document, from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Receipt_ID [RcptId] in the AR_Cash_Received [ArCashRcvd] table.
AR Cash Application Invoice ID Invoice Generated

Unique identifier for the invoice, from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if the adjustment is at the customer (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the SAL_Invoices_Generated [SalInvoiGen] table.
AR Cash Application Settlement Method Code Settlement Method

Code for the settlement method.Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money.EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Application Cash AR Remark

Number of the GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

AR Adjustment

Contains all adjustments recorded against the invoice and impacting the invoice balance during the period. (e.g. write-offs, credit memos, and other adjustments). The data set shall contain one record for each adjustment to each invoice. For example, if an adjustment transaction impacted three invoices, there shall be three records for that adjustment: one for each of the invoices impacted by the adjustment.
AR Adjustment ID
Unique identifier for the adjustment of a record.Typically auto-generated by the system.
AR Adjustment Number

Number of the adjustment of the record.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. This number can be created by concatenating fields to uniquely identify each transaction (e.g. serial number, document type, adjustment date).
AR Adjustment Type Name
Name of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer.EXAMPLE Credit memo, debit memo, finance charge, other adjustments.
AR Adjustment Document Number

Number of an internally generated adjustment document (e.g. credit memo).This number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system-based rules (e.g. document number, document type, year).
AR Adjustment Invoice ID Invoice Generated

Unique identifier for the invoice, from which AR is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.This field represents the invoice against which the adjustment is applied, if relevant.May be set to NULL if the adjustment is at the customer (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the SAL_Invoices_Generated [SalInvoiGen] table.
AR Adjustment Journal ID Gl Details
Unique identifier for journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Journal_ID [JrnId] in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table.
AR Adjustment Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Adjustment_Date [AdjDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
AR Adjustment Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Adjustment_Date [AdjDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
AR Adjustment Date
Date of the adjustment, regardless of the date when the adjustment was created.
AR Adjustment Customer Account ID Customer

Unique identifier for the customer from whom payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
AR Adjustment GL Debit Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Number of the GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Sales Contract Beginning Date

Sales Contract Ending Date

Sales Order

Contains summary information of sales orders pertinent to orders placed during the period under review. Sales orders are included in the three-way match procedures, which control the decision process for AR entries.
Sales Order ID
Unique identifier for the order.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Sales Order Number
Number of the order.This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.
Sales Order Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Order_Date [OrdDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.

Sales Order Type Name

Name of the order type in sales or purchase activities.The types of sales orders are usually allocated by users of the system according to different business needs.EXAMPLE Some enterprises are configured as non-contract orders, trial orders, factory orders and store orders.EXAMPLE Ordinary purchasing, outsourcing parts, process outsourcing.
Sales Order Date

Date of the purchase order and date of signing of the sales order.It is the effective date of the order, not the system created date. The order of a certain period is counted based on the effective date.

Unique identifier for the payer.Typically auto-generated by the system.There are different purchase models in the group company (e.g. centralized purchase, decentralized payment, decentralization of procurement, centralized payment). Invoice Generated

Contains summary information for the invoices generated during the period under review. Invoices are included in the three-way match procedures, which control the decision process for AR entries. Each line includes invoice ID, invoice number, invoice date, customer, invoice amount, currency type, tax type, tax amount, settlement method and payment terms.
Generated Sales Invoice ID
Unique identifier for the invoice.Typically auto-generated by the system.The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data.
Generated Sales Invoice Number
Number of the invoice.This number is usually generated by manual input or is system-generated (e.g. including serial number, document type, date).
Sales Invoice Generated Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Invoice_Date [InvoiDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Sales Invoice Generated Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Invoice_Date [InvoiDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Generated Sales Official Invoice Code
Unique official code of the invoice, which is usually generated by the tax authorities.
Generated Sales Invoice Type Name
The name of the invoice type. The documents are classified according to business content.
Generated Sales Invoice Date
Date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.
Generated Sales Invoice Due Date
Date when the payment is due.Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.
Sales Invoice Generated Customer Account ID Customer
Unique identifier for the receiving customer.Typically autogenerated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
Generated Invoice Sales Settlement Method Code

Code value for the method used for cash receipts from customers.EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Generated Sales Invoice Transaction Amount

The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency.No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.
Sales Invoice Generated Invoice Transaction Currency Code Currency
Transactional currency appearing in the invoice (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Sales Invoice Generated Payment Term Code Payment Term
Code for the payment term.EXAMPLE Cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.Shall match the Payment_Term_Code [PayTermCd] in the BAS_Payment_Term [BasPayTerm] table.
Generated Invoice Sales Terms Discount Percentage
Discount percentage that can be provided if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.Terms are represented as integers to a decimal place.EXAMPLE 10 % is 0.10.
Generated Invoice Sales Terms Discount Days
Number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms.Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places.EXAMPLE 10 days are 10.
Generated Invoice Sales Terms Due Days
Number of days allowed that the customer has to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
Generated Invoice Sales Grouping Code
Grouping mechanism for related items in a batch or grouping of invoices (e.g. the invoice grouping found in certain ERP systems).
Generated Invoice Sales Status
Status of the invoice.EXAMPLE New, save, submit, frozen.
Generated Invoice Sales Remark
Free-form text description.

Open Account Payable

Contains details regarding all open, unpaid, or unresolved payable transactions as of a specified date. Each row in this table represents the balance due to the supplier for one uniquely identifiable transaction. This file should be at the summary level (by invoice), not at the detailed level (by invoice line item). The sum total of the transaction amounts as of the specified date shall reconcile to the total AP amount in the general ledger (GL) as of the same date.
Payable Account Open Transaction ID
Unique identifier for the transaction of open AP that includes invoice and cash paid.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Open Account Payable Invoice ID Invoice Received

Unique identifier for the invoice, from which AP is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if the adjustment is at the supplier (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the PUR_Invoices_Received [PurInvoiRcvd] table.
Open Account Payable Supplier Account ID Supplier

Unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is expected or from whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Open Account Payable Purchase Contract ID Purchase Contract

Unique identifier for the purchase contract, from which AP is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if there is no Purchase_Contract_ID [PurContrId]. Otherwise shall match the Purchase_Contract_ID [PurContrId] in the PUR_Contracts [PurContr] table.
Open Account Payable Project ID Project

Unique identifier for the project, from which AP is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if no Project_ID [ProjId]. Otherwise shall match the Project_ID [ProjId] in the BAS_Project [BasProj] table.
Open Account Payable Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Transaction_Date [TrDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Open Account Payable Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Transaction_Date [TrDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Payable Account Open Transaction Date
Date of the transaction, regardless of the date when the transaction is created.This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.
Open Account Payable Journal ID Gl Details
Unique identifier for journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Journal_ID [JrnId] in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table.
Payable Account Open Transaction Due Date

Date when the payment is due from the supplier.Not all transactions will have a due date. May be set to NULL if there is no due date (e.g. for credit memos). Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.
Payable Account Open Reference Number
Number of an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check number, wire transfer number, original document ID.
Payable Account Open Reference Date
Date on an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check date, wire transfer date.

Accounting period in which the Payment_Date [PayDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Made Payment Date
Payment date of the account payable by the supplier.
Payment Made Settlement Method Code Settlement Method

Code value or indicator for the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was settled or apportioned by the supplier.EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Made Payment Reference Number
Number of an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check number, wire transfer number, original document ID.
Made Payment Reference Date
Date on an internally or externally generated transaction.EXAMPLE Check date, wire transfer date.
Made Payment Amount Credit Debit Indicator
Indicates whether the amount is a credit or a debit.EXAMPLE C is credit, D is debit.
Made Payment Remark
Free-form text description.

Number of the GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted.This number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system-based rules.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

AP Cash Application

Contains information of all cash payments applied against the invoice during the period under review. The table will have one line for each application of a cash payment to an invoice. For example, if a cash payment was applied to three invoices, there will be three records for that payment - one for each of the invoices to which the cash was applied. In the context of this process, cash means any type of payment received including checks and wire transfers and cash.
Cash AP Application ID
Unique identifier for the application of cash from a payment to each invoice.Typically auto-generated by the system.
AP Cash Application Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the AP_Application_Date [ApAplDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
AP Cash Application Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the AP_Application_Date [ApAplDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Cash AP Application Date
Date of the cash application transaction, regardless of the date when the transaction was created.
AP Cash Application Supplier Account ID Supplier

Unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been received.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
AP Cash Application Payment ID AP Payment Made
Unique identifier for the transactional document, from which AP is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Payment_ID [PayId] in the AP_Payments_Made [ApPayMade] table.
AP Cash Application Invoice ID Invoice Received

Unique identifier for the invoice, from which AP is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if the adjustment is at the supplier (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the PUR_Invoices_Received [PurInvoiRcvd] table.
AP Cash Application Settlement Method Code Settlement Method

Code value or indicator for the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was settled or apportioned by the supplier.EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.

AP Adjustment

Contains all adjustments recorded against the invoice and impacting the invoice balance during the period. For example, write-offs, credit memos, and other adjustments. The table will have one line for each adjustment to each invoice. For example, if an adjustment transaction impacted three invoices, there will be three records for that adjustment-one for each of the invoices impacted by the adjustment.
AP Adjustment ID
Unique identifier for the adjustment of a record.Typically auto-generated by the system.
AP Adjustment Number

Number of the adjustment of the record.This number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system based rules. This number may need to be created by concatenating fields to uniquely identify each transaction (e.g. serial number, document type, adjustment date).
AP Adjustment Type Name
Name of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the supplier.EXAMPLE Credit memo, debit memo, finance charge, other adjustments.
AP Adjustment Document Number

Number of an internally generated adjustment document (e.g. credit memo).This number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system-based rules (e.g. document number, document type, year).
AP Adjustment Invoice ID Invoice Received

Unique identifier for the invoice, from which AP is derived.Typically auto-generated by the system.This field represents the invoice against which the adjustment is applied, if relevant. May be set to NULL if the adjustment is at the supplier (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the PUR_Invoices_Received [PurInvoiRcvd] table.
AP Adjustment Journal ID Gl Details
Unique identifier for journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Journal_ID [JrnId] in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table.
AP Adjustment Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Adjustment_Date [AdjDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
AP Adjustment Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Adjustment_Date [AdjDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
AP Adjustment Date
Date of the adjustment, regardless of the date when the adjustment was created.
AP Adjustment Supplier Account ID Supplier

Unique identifier for the supplier from whom payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
AP Adjustment GL Debit Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Unique identifier for an employee. Shall match Employee_ID [EmpId] in BAS_Employee [BasEmp].

Code for the employee. Each employee has only one code. Shall match the Employee_Code [EmpCd] in BAS_Employee [BasEmp].Shall match the Employee_Code [EmpCd] in the BAS_Employee [BasEmp] table.

The name of employee. Shall match the Employee_Name [EmpNm] in the BAS_Employee [BasEmp] table. Shall match the Employee_Name [EmpNm] in BAS_Employee [BasEmp].

Name of employee type. Shall match the Employee_Type_Name [EmpTypNm] in BAS_Employee [BasEmp]. EXAMPLE Employed, retired, probation, part-time.

Payroll statistics year. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Payroll_Year [PayrollYr] in the PAY_Payroll_Period [PayPayrollPer] table.
Payslip Payroll Period Pay Payroll Period
Salary statistics period is made of year and month, EXAMPLE Mar-2021. Shall match the Payroll_Period [PayrollPer] in the PAY_Payroll_Period [PayPayrollPer] table (see Table 6).

Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.

Code for the currency (in accordance with ISO 4217). Shall match Currency_Code [CurCd] in BAS_Currency [BasCur].

The amount of payroll payment with speicifed currency.

The date of payroll payment.

The number of the account opened by the employee in the bank.

Invoice Received

Contains summary information for the invoices received during the period under review. Invoices are included in the three-way match procedures, which control the decision process for AP entries. Each line includes invoice ID, invoice number, invoice date, supplier, invoice amount, currency type, tax type, tax amount, settle method and payment terms.
Received Invoice ID
Unique identifier for the invoice.Typically auto-generated by the system.The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data.
Received Invoice Number
Number of the invoice.This number is usually generated by manual input or is system-generated (e.g. including serial number, document type, date).
Invoice Received Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Invoice_Date [InvoiDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Invoice Received Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Invoice_Date [InvoiDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Received Official Invoice Code
Unique official code of the invoice, which is usually generated by the tax authorities.
Received Invoice Type Name
The name of the invoice type. The documents are classified according to business content.
Received Invoice Date
Date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.
Received Invoice Due Date
Date when the payment is due.Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.
Invoice Received Supplier Account ID Supplier

Unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Invoice Received Settlement Organization Code Business Segment

The unique code of the settlement organization (Organization of the payment, can be different from the receiving organization). May be the purchase organization or the receipt organization. Shall match the Unique_Bus_Seg_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Received Invoice Settlement Method Code

Code value for the method used for cash receipts from customers.EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Received Invoice Transaction Amount

The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency.No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.
Invoice Received Invoice Transaction Currency Code Currency
Transactional currency appearing in the invoice (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Invoice Received Payment Term Code Payment Term
Code for the payment term.EXAMPLE Cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.Shall match the Payment_Term_Code [PayTermCd] in the BAS_Payment_Term [BasPayTerm] table.
Received Invoice Terms Discount Percentage
Discount percentage that can be provided if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.Terms are represented as integers to a decimal place.EXAMPLE 10 % is 0.10.
Received Invoice Terms Discount Days
Number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms.Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places.EXAMPLE 10 days are 10.
Received Invoice Terms Due Days
Number of days allowed that the customer has to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
Received Invoice Grouping Code
Grouping mechanism for related items in a batch or grouping of invoices (e.g. the invoice grouping found in certain ERP systems).
Received Invoice Status
Status of the invoice.EXAMPLE New, save, submit, frozen.
Received Invoice Remark
Free-form text description.

Tax Transaction Amount
The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transaction currency.
