Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Inventory Product
Contains basic attributes of an inventory item and other tracked item through the purchase, use and sales.
Inventory Product ID
Unique identifier for the inventory item.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Inventory Product Code
Internal code of the inventory product at the local level for tracking this product.
Inventory Product Inventory Product Type ID Inventory Product Type

Unique identifier for the inventory product type used to express inventory or product type with hierarchy.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Inventory_Product_Type_ID [InvPrdctTypId] in the INV_Product_Type [InvPrdctTyp] table.
Inventory Product Group1
Product descriptor #1.EXAMPLE Tires, accessories.
Inventory Product Group2
Product descriptor #2.EXAMPLE Brand.
Product Inventory Bar Code
Universal Product Code or other external identifier.EXAMPLE The product code from a primary supplier.
Inventory Product Preferred Supplier ID Supplier

Unique identifier for the supplier that the organization has designated as the first choice from whom to procure this item.The selection may be for contractual or practical reasons, which may include historical reliability and quality, advantageous terms (e.g. delivery, pricing), a specific customer request or other reasons.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] from the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Inventory Product Basic UOM Code Measurement Unit

Code for the basic measurement unit for the inventory, which cannot be further separated.EXAMPLE The basic measurement unit for a pencil is pieces, however, the business can also use boxes as a measurement unit for stocking or for managerial purposes.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Product Inventory Default Costing Method
Description of the costing method.EXAMPLE LIFO, FIFO, average, standard, specific identification.
Inventory Product Default Stocking UOM Code Measurement Unit

Code for the measurement unit that is normally used for stock.EXAMPLE To measure pencils for stocking purpose, boxes as measurement unit is usually used, which is different from the basic measurement unit pieces.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory Product GL Asset Account Number Chart Of Accounts

Number of the GL account on which the balance sheet amount of inventory product is recognized.EXAMPLE Identifier for the raw inventory account.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Inventory Product GL Cost Account Number Chart Of Accounts

Number of the GL account on which the income statement amount of inventory product is recognized.EXAMPLE Identifier for the cost of sales account.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Product Inventory Out Of Service Date
Date when the inventory is out of service.EXAMPLE The date when the inventory is discontinued due to changes in design and replacement of materials.
Product Inventory Out Of Service Flag
Sign of out-of-service status.EXAMPLE 0 is no, 1 is yes.
Product Inventory Lot Number
Number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
Product Inventory Serial Number
Number associated with an individual product item that is used for tracking and managing.EXAMPLE A company purchases 10 computers, with each computer assigned an individual serial number.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Inventory On Hand
Contains information of inventory on hand (e.g. suppliers, quantities of items by location and amounts as of the specified date).
Hand On Inventory ID

Unique identifier for the inventory.Typically auto-generated by the system. The unique value means that each line in the data table under consideration has a unique, non-repetitive, serial number for identification.
Inventory On Hand Inventory Product ID Inventory Product
Unique identifier for the inventory item.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId] in the INV_Product [InvPrdct] table.
Hand On Inventory Lot Number
Number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
Hand On Inventory Serial Number
Number associated with an individual product item that is used for tracking and managing.EXAMPLE A company purchases 10 computers, with each computer assigned an individual serial number.
Hand On Inventory ABC Code

Code for the importance, monetary value or other measure of the item according to Markov's rule for selective inventory control, where 20 % of items are responsible for 80 % of the value or risk.A = top 20 % representing 80 % of risk:B = 30 %, representing 15 % of risk:C = 50 % of items representing only 5 % of risk.
Inventory On Hand Location ID Inventory Location

Unique identifier for the organization.Shall be a valid entry in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Location_ID [LctId] in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.
Hand On Inventory As Of Date
Specified date to which inventory information applies.
Hand On Inventory INV PUR YearToDate Quantity
Quantity purchased to this location year to date in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Hand On Inventory INV Sold YearToDate Quantity
Quantity sold from this location year to date in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Inventory On Hand Inventory Organization Code Business Segment

Code for the inventory organization, which refers to the organizational unit, physical or virtual, where the inventory transaction and balances may be tracked and monitored.It provides inventory information to modules such as purchase and sales. The simplest form of inventory organization is warehouse.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Inventory On Hand Cost Organization Code Business Segment

Code for the cost organization, which refers to the organizational unit/level where the cost of outbound inventory will be calculated.The calculation may be done at the corporate level, the stocking organization level or at the particular locations where inventory is stored.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Inventory On Hand Inventory Costing UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit for the inventory's cost.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory On Hand Inventory Purchasing UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the primary measurement unit of how goods enter the organization through purchase.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory On Hand Inventory Selling UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the primary measurement unit of how goods leave the organization through sales.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory On Hand Inventory Stocking UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit used associated with the quantity used for stocking inventory.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Hand On Inventory Quantity
Book quantity as expressed in the Inventory_Stocking_UOM_Code [InvStckUomCd].
Hand On Inventory System Quantity
Actual quantity on hand from the physical count in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Hand On Inventory Physical Count Quantity
Quantity on hand at the last physical count when multiple counts are performed in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Hand On Inventory Last Count Date
Date of the last physical count.
Hand On Inventory List Price
List or suggested retail price.
Hand On Inventory Cost
Cost per unit using the method found in the Inventory_Cost_Method [InvCostMthd].
Hand On Inventory Cost Method
Description of the costing method.EXAMPLE LIFO, FIFO, average, standard, specific identification.
Hand On Inventory Average Cost
Average cost of per unit.
Hand On Inventory Standard Cost
Standard cost per unit.
Hand On Inventory Specific Cost
Specific cost per unit.
Inventory On Hand Functional Currency Code Currency
Functional or group currency related to the balance (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Hand On Inventory Bin ID
Optional identifier for the sub-location. The code used in the system.
Hand On Inventory Bin Location
Description of the bin location used in the system.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Business Segment
Segment Business Sequence Number
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Inventory Transaction
Contains transaction history impacting the inventory accounts during the specified time period.
Inventory Transaction Document ID
Unique identifier for the picking ticket, shipping notice or other document created upon or associated with movement.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Inventory Transaction Document Line ID
Unique identifier for the line number for a document other than a customer order or supplier purchase order.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Inventory Transaction Project ID Project
Unique identifier for the project.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Project_ID [ProjId] in the BAS_Project [BasProj] table.
Inventory Transaction Order ID
Unique identifier for the customer order, (supplier) purchase order or other document associated with the transaction.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Inventory Transaction Order Line ID

Unique identifier for the line item from a customer order or (supplier) purchase order, in order to differentiate between multiple items in a single order for different quantities.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Inventory Transaction Date
Date of activity per associated transaction document, if applicable.
Inventory Transaction Time
Time of the activity as per the associated transaction document, if applicable.
Inventory Transaction Type

Captures information regarding movements and adjustments.Movement types may include receipt, shipment, transfer, return, moved to production and moved from production. Quantity adjustment types may include physical count adjustment, damage, obsolete and scrapped. Cost adjustments may include the lowering of cost or market realization.
Inventory Transaction Type System
Transaction code local to the underlying accounting software system.
Inventory Transaction Description
Description of the transaction.
Inventory Transaction Quantity

Quantity affected as expressed in the location stocking organization in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd]. When the inventory is received, the number involved will be a positive number. When the inventory is dispatched, the number involved will be a negative number.
Inventory Transaction Supplier Account ID Supplier
Unique identifier for the supplier.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Inventory Transaction Customer Account ID Customer
Unique identifier for the receiving customer.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
Transaction Inventory Document ID
Unique identifier for the inventory document, specifying the sources where the inventory originates.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Transaction Inventory Document Number
Number of the inventory document.This number is usually generated by manual input or is system-generated.EXAMPLE 201305020001.
Transaction Inventory Document Line ID
Unique identifier for the inventory document line.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Transaction Inventory Document Line Number
Number of the inventory document line.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Transaction Inventory Status
Status of the inventory document.EXAMPLE New, save, submit, void, frozen.
Inventory Transaction Inventory Organization Code Business Segment

Code for the inventory organization, which refers to the organizational unit, physical or virtual, where the inventory transaction and balances may be tracked and monitored.It provides inventory information to modules such as purchase and sales. The simplest form of inventory organization is warehouse.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Inventory Transaction Inventory Stocking UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit used associated with the quantity used for stocking inventory.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory Transaction Inventory Costing UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit for the inventory's cost.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory Transaction Inventory Product ID Inventory Product
Unique identifier for the inventory item.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId] in the INV_Product [InvPrdct] table.
Transaction Inventory Lot Number
Number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
Transaction Inventory Serial Number
Number associated with an individual product item that is used for tracking and managing.EXAMPLE A company purchases 10 computers, with each computer assigned an individual serial number.
Transaction Inventory Required By
Person or organization that makes the requisition for an inventory.
Inventory Transaction Inventory From Location ID Inventory Location
Unique identifier for the stock trading source location.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Location_ID [LctId] in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.
Inventory Transaction Inventory To Location ID Inventory Location
Unique identifier for the stock trading destination.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Location_ID [LctId] in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.
Inventory Transaction Cost Organization Code Business Segment

Code for the cost organization, which refers to the organizational unit/level where the cost of outbound inventory will be calculated.The calculation may be done at the corporate level, the stocking organization level or at the particular locations where inventory is stored.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Transaction Inventory Cost
Cost per unit using the method found in the Inventory_Cost_Method [InvCostMthd].
Inventory Transaction Adjustment Cost
Per unit increase or decrease in the stocking cost as represented in field Inventory_Cost_Method [InvCostMthd] of the INV_On_Hand [InvOnHand] table.
Inventory Transaction Functional Currency Code Currency
Functional or group currency related to the balance (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Transaction Inventory INV System Or External Source

Indicates whether the inventory transaction has originated within or outside the Inventory module.I is used for an internally initiated transaction and E is used for an externally initiated one.EXAMPLE Purchase or sale.
Transaction Inventory INV Received And Dispatched Flag
Indicates whether the inventory is received or dispatched.
Inventory Transaction GL Line Debit Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Inventory Transaction GL Line Credit Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Physical Inventory Count Sheet ID

Physical Inventory Count Sheet Number

Physical Inventory Count Sheet Line ID
Unique identifier for the inventory count sheet line.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Physical Inventory INV Count Sheet Line Number
Number of the line of the inventory count sheet.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Inventory Physical Inventory Inventory Product ID Inventory Product

Inventory Physical Inventory Location ID Inventory Location

Unique identifier for the organization.Shall be a valid entry in INV_Location [InvLct].Typically auto-generated by the system and used for data linking.Shall match the Location_ID [LctId] in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.
Inventory Physical Inventory Inventory Organization Code Business Segment

Physical Inventory Lot Number
Number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
Physical Inventory Serial Number

Inventory Physical Inventory Inventory Stocking UOM Code Measurement Unit

Physical Inventory Phisical Count Quantity

Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Inventory Period Balance
Contains inventory information regarding its beginning and ending balances, quantities and durational quantities and amounts.
Balance Period Inventory Product ID
Unique identifier for the inventory item.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId] in the INV_Product [InvPrdct] table.
Balance Period Inventory Location ID

Unique identifier for the organization.Shall be a valid entry in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Location_ID [LctId] in the INV_Location [InvLct] table.
Inventory Period Balance Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Inventory Period Balance Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the financial statement occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Inventory Period Balance Inventory Organization Code Business Segment
Code for the inventory organization.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Balance Period Inventory Lot Number
Number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
Balance Period Inventory Beginning Quantity
Quantity of an inventory as of the beginning in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Balance Period Inventory Ending Quantity
Quantity of an inventory as of the ending in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Balance Period Inventory INV Received Quantity
Goods-received quantity of cumulative inventory materials at a current period in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Balance Period Inventory INV Dispatched Quantity
Goods-dispatched quantity of cumulative inventory materials at a current period in the Basic_UOM_Code [BasicUomCd].
Balance Period Inventory INV Debit Amount
Cumulative debit amount of inventory materials at a current period.
Balance Period Inventory INV Credit Amount
Cumulative credit amount of inventory materials at a current period.
Period Inventory Beginning Balance
Beginning balance of an inventory.
Period Inventory Ending Balance
Ending balance of an inventory.
Inventory Period Balance Cost Organization Code Business Segment
Code for the cost organization.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Inventory Period Balance Inventory Stocking UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit used associated with the quantity used for stocking inventory.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Inventory Period Balance Inventory Costing UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit for the inventory's cost.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.

Segment Business Sequence Number

Business Segment Business Segment Code Business Segment
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Property Plant and Equipment Type
Contains the details of each PPE type.
Equipment and Plant Property Type Code
Unique code of letters and/or numbers used to represent or identify a PPE type.EXAMPLE 0201 is manufacturing equipment, 0202 is working equipment.
Equipment and Plant Property Type Name
Name of the type categorized by the PPE attributes.EXAMPLE Land, buildings, machinery, equipment.
PPE Type Parent Type ID PPE Type
Unique identifier for the parent PPE type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Type_Code [TypCd] in the PPE_Type [PpeTyp] table.
PPE Master
Contains the details of each PPE item (e.g. its code, specification, location, acquiring date, original cost, quantity).
Master PPE ID
Unique identifier for the PPE.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Master PPE Code
Internal code of the PPE at the local level.
Master PPE Tag Number

Tag that used to be commonly used when there was no ERP system to record the PPE's state of the whole lifespan. It is still used by some ERP systems in the business of PPE.This number is usually generated by manual input or is system-generated.EXAMPLE When there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. Each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID [PpeId] as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID [PpeId] is the same as the Tag_Number [TagNr].
PPE Master Type Code PPE Type
Unique code of the PPE type.Shall match the Type_Code [TypCd] in the PPE_Type [PpeTyp] table.
Master PPE Name
Name of the PPE.
Master PPE Feature
Feature used to specify the PPE more clearly.EXAMPLE Brand, colour, size, configuration.
Master PPE Bar Code
Universal Product Code or other external code.EXAMPLE The product code from a primary supplier.
PPE Master Purchase Order ID Purchase Order

Unique identifier for the purchase order.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if the PPE is not generated from a purchase order. Otherwise shall match the Purchase_Order_ID [PurOrdId] in the PUR_Orders_Details [PurOrdDtls] table.
PPE Master Inventory Product ID Inventory Product

Unique identifier for the inventory item.Typically auto-generated by the system.May be set to NULL if the PPE is not generated from inventory. Otherwise shall match the Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId] in the INV_Product [InvPrdct].
Master PPE Serial Number
Number associated with an individual PPE that is used for tracking and managing.EXAMPLE A company purchases 10 computers, with each computer assigned an individual serial number.
Master PPE Lot Number
Number associated with a PPE that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
Master PPE Manufacturer
Manufacturer of the PPE.
PPE Master Supplier Account ID Supplier
Unique identifier for the supplier.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Master PPE Location Description
Description of the location where the PPE is placed.
Master PPE Condition Name
Name of the various usage status of PPE.EXAMPLE Asset in-use, not-in-use, not-in-use for seasonal reasons.
Master PPE Acquisition Date
Date when the PPE is acquired.
Master PPE Posted Date
Date when PPE is posted into accounts.
Master PPE Placed Into Service Date
Date that PPE is placed into use.
Master PPE Quantity On Hand
Quantity of PPE items on hand.
PPE Master UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code for the measurement unit for measuring the quantity of PPE.Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Master PPE Useful Life
Total useful life of the PPE in months.
Master PPE Useful Life Remaining
Remaining useful life of the PPE in months as of the report date.
Master PPE Original Cost
Original cost of the PPE.
Master PPE Residual Value
Residual value of the PPE as of the report date.Typically calculated by an expected residual value ratio.
Master PPE Accumulated Depreciation
Accumulated depreciation of the PPE as of the report date.
Master PPE Impairment Provision
Impairment provision of PPE as of the report date.
Master PPE Net Book Value
Net book value of PPE as of the report date, which equals the original cost minus accumulated depreciation and impairment provision.
Master PPE Replacement Cost
Replacement cost of the PPE as of the report date.
Master PPE Fair Value
Fair value of PPE as of the report date.
PPE Master Functional Currency Code Currency
Functional or group currency related to the balance (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Master PPE Account Number

GL account number on which the Balance Sheet amount is recognized after the asset has been put into operation.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Master PPE Impairment Provision Account Number

Number of the GL account on which the Balance Sheet amount is recognized for an impairment provision account.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Master PPE Accumulated Depreciation Account Number

Number of the GL account on which the Balance Sheet amount is recognized for accumulated depreciation.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

PPE Addition
Contains the information of PPE addition transactions.
PPE Addition ID
Unique identifier for the addition entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.
PPE Addition PPE ID PPE Master
Unique identifier for the PPE.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the PPE_ID [PpeId] in the PPE_Master [PpeMaster] table.
PPE Addition Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Addition_Date [AddDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
PPE Addition Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Addition_Date [AddDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Addition PPE Tag Number

Tag that used to be commonly used when there was no ERP system to record the PPE's state of the whole lifespan. It is still used by some ERP systems in the business of PPE.This number is usually generated by manual input or is system-generated.EXAMPLE When there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. Each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID [PpeId] as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID [PpeId] is the same as the Tag_Number [TagNr].
PPE Addition Type Name
Description of the addition type.EXAMPLE Purchase, Invest, Donate.
PPE Addition Date
Date when the addition transaction happens.
PPE Addition Reason
Reason why the PPE is added.
PPE Addition Quantity
Quantity of PPE to be added.
Addition PPE Original Cost
Original cost of the PPE.
PPE Addition Functional Currency Code Currency
Functional or group currency related to the balance (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.

PPE Removal PPE ID PPE Master
Unique identifier for the PPE.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the PPE_ID [PpeId] in the PPE_Master [PpeMaster] table.
PPE Removal Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Removal_Date [RmvDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
PPE Removal Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Removal_Date [RmvDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Removal PPE Tag Number

Tag that used to be commonly used when there was no ERP system to record the PPE's state of the whole lifespan. It is still used by some ERP systems in the business of PPE.This number is usually generated by manual input or is system-generated.EXAMPLE When there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. Each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID [PpeId] as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID [PpeId] is the same as the Tag_Number [TagNr].
PPE Removal Type Name
Description of the removal type.EXAMPLE Sale, retirement, disposal, damaged.
PPE Removal Date
Date when the PPE is removed.
PPE Removal Reason
Reason why there was a removal.
PPE Removal Quantity
Reduced quantity of the PPE.
PPE Removal Original Cost
Reduced original cost during the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Accumulated Depreciation
Reduced accumulated depreciation during the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Impairment Provision
Reduced impairment provision during the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Residual Value
Reduced residual value during the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Cash Proceeds Amount
Amount of cash proceeds received from the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Non Cash Proceeds Amount
Amount of non-cash proceeds received from the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Expense
Expense generated from the removal transaction.
Removal PPE Unrealized Gain Loss Amount
Amount of the unrealized gain/loss recorded on the Balance Sheet of the removal transaction.
Removal PPE Realized Gain Loss Amount
Amount of realized gain/loss recorded on the Income Statement related to the removal transaction.
PPE Removal Functional Currency Code Currency
Functional or group currency related to the balance (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.

Number of the GL account on which Balance Sheet amount is recorded for unrealized gain/loss.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Method PPE Depreciation Formula

PPE Depreciation
Contains the information correlating with PPE summarized depreciation in the period.
PPE Depreciation PPE ID PPE Master
Unique identifier for the PPE.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the PPE_ID [PpeId] in the PPE_Master [PpeMaster] table.
PPE Depreciation Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the Created_Date occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
PPE Depreciation Accounting Period Accounting Period

Accounting period in which the Created_Date occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
PPE Depreciation Depreciation Method ID PPE Depreciation Method
Field used to specify the depreciation method.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Depreciation_Method_ID [DepreMthdId] in the PPE_Depreciation_Method [PpeDepreMthd] table.
Depreciation PPE Useful Life
Total useful life of the PPE in months.
Depreciation PPE Useful Life Remaining
Remaining useful life of the PPE in months as of the report date.
Depreciation PPE Original Cost
Original cost of the PPE.
Depreciation PPE Residual Value
Residual value of the PPE as of the report date.Typically calculated by an expected residual value ratio.
Depreciation PPE Depreciable Basis
Depreciable basis of PPE, which shows the difference between the original cost and residual value.
PPE Depreciation Amount
Amount of depreciation recognized during the period.
PPE Accumulated Depreciation
Accumulated depreciation of the PPE as of the report date.
Depreciation PPE Carrying Amount
Carrying amount of PPE as of the report date, which shows the difference between the original cost and accumulated depreciation.
PPE Depreciation Depreciation Account Number Chart Of Accounts

Number of the GL account on which the Income Statement amount is recognized for depreciation.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
PPE Depreciation Accumulated Depreciation Account Number Chart Of Accounts

Number of the GL account on which the Balance Sheet amount is recognized for accumulated depreciation.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.

Selection Period

Unique identifier that refers to the selection criteria for selecting tables and fields. The permitted values of Selection_ID [SelectionId] and the associated selection criteria should be determined by mutual agreement between the auditor and the auditee.EXAMPLE: ADC Customs NL
Period Selection ID
Unique identifier that refers to the separately defined criteria for selecting tables and fields. Typically according with the data recipient (for example by Dutch Customs).
Period Selection Start Date
Start date of the selected period (YYYY-MM-DD). The start time is always "00:00:00".
Period Selection End Date
End date of the selected period (YYYY-MM-DD). The end time is always "23:59:59".
Gl Details Characteristics
Characteristics information about the customer, goods, location, size of business etc, that apply to the GL_Details [GlDtls].
Gl Details Characteristics Journal ID Gl Details
Unique identifier for the journal entry.Shall match the Journal_ID [JrnId] in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table.
Characteristics Details Gl Characteristic Type

Type of characteristic in relation to the GL_Details [GlDtls] line. The permitted values of Characteristic_Type [CharTyp] should be determined by mutual agreement between the auditor and the auditee.EXAMPLE NL_VATSTATUS
Characteristics Details Gl Characteristic Sequence Number

The sequence number of a characteristic or group of related characteristics within the same Journal_ID [JrnId].The sequence number is mandatory if there are multiple characteristics of the same type within the same Journal_ID [JrnId].
Gl Details Characteristics Characteristic UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code of measurement of the value of the characteristic, if applicable. Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table. EXAMPLE PERC, KG
Characteristics Details Gl Characteristic Value
The value of the characteristic on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. EXAMPLE- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 percent.- L in case of low-rated VAT product.
Characteristics Details Gl System Characteristic Value

The value of the characteristic as recorded in the source system of the organization to be audited, on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. EXAMPLE:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- 1 in case of low-rated VAT product.
Sales Invoice Details Characteristics

Type of characteristic in relation to the invoice or invoice line. The permitted values of Characteristic_Type [CharTyp] should be determined by mutual agreement between the auditor and the auditee.EXAMPLE NL_VATSTATUS
Sales Invoice Details Characteristics Invoice ID Invoice Generated
Unique identifier for the invoice. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data. Shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the SAL_Invoices_Generated [SalInvoiGen] table.
Sales Invoice Details Characteristics Invoice Line ID Invoice Generated Details
Unique identifier for the invoice line. If not empty it shall match the Invoice_Line_ID [InvoiLnId] in the SAL_Invoices_Generated_Details [SalInvoiGenDtls] table.
Characteristics Details Invoice Sales Characteristic Type
Standardized type of characteristic in relation to the invoice line.EXAMPLE NL_VAT_ITEM_STATUS.
Characteristics Details Invoice Sales Characteristic Sequence Number

The sequence number of a characteristic or group of related characteristics within the same Invoice_ID [InvoiId] and Invoice_Line_ID [InvoiLnId] combination.The sequence number is mandatory if there are multiple characteristics of the same type within the same Invoice_ID [InvoiId] and Invoice_Line_ID [InvoiLnId] combination.
Sales Invoice Details Characteristics Characteristic UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code of measurement of the value of the characteristic, if applicable. Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table. EXAMPLE PERC, KG
Characteristics Details Invoice Sales Characteristic Value
The value of the product characteristic on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. EXAMPLE:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- L in case of low-rated VAT product.
Characteristics Details Invoice Sales System Characteristic Value

The value of the characteristic as recorded in the source system of the organization to be audited, on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. EXAMPLE:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- 1 in case of low-rated VAT product.
Purchase Invoice Details Characteristics

Characteristics information about the customer, goods, location, size of business etc, that apply to the PUR_Invoices_Received [PurInvoiRcvd] table and PUR_Invoices_Received_Details [PurInvoiRcvdDtls] table.

Unique identifier for the invoice. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data. Shall match the Invoice_ID [InvoiId] in the PUR_Invoices_Received [PurInvoiRcvd] table.

Unique identifier for the invoice line. If not empty it shall match the Invoice_Line_ID [InvoiLnId] in the PUR_Invoices_Received_Details [PurInvoiRcvdDtls] table.

Type of characteristic in relation to the invoice or invoice line. The permitted values of Characteristic_Type [CharTyp] should be determined by mutual agreement between the auditor and the auditee.EXAMPLE NL_VATITEMSTATUS
Characteristics Details Invoice Purchase Characteristic Sequence Number

The sequence number of a characteristic or group of related characteristics within the same Invoice_ID [InvoiId] and Invoice_Line_ID [InvoiLnId] combination.The sequence number is mandatory if there are multiple characteristics of the same type within the same Invoice_ID [InvoiId] and Invoice_Line_ID [InvoiLnId] combination.
Purchase Invoice Details Characteristics Characteristic UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code of measurement of the value of the characteristic, if applicable. Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table. EXAMPLE PERC, KG
Characteristics Details Invoice Purchase Characteristic Value
The value of the product characteristic on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. EXAMPLE:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- L in case of low-rated VAT product.
Characteristics Details Invoice Purchase System Characteristic Value

The value of the characteristic as recorded in the source system of the organization to be audited, on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. EXAMPLE:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- 1 in case of low-rated VAT product.
Inventory Product Characteristics
Contains inventory product characteristic information from a certain start date and time until a certain end date and time: For example the alcohol percentage.
Inventory Product Characteristics Inventory Product ID Inventory Product
The unique identifier for the inventory item. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId] in the INV_Product [InvPrdct] table.
Characteristics Product Inventory Characteristic Type

Type of characteristic of the product.The permitted values of Characteristic_Type [CharTyp] should be determined by mutual agreement between the auditor and the auditee.EXAMPLE EU_COMCODE, GEN_ALCPERC
Characteristics Product Inventory Characteristic Sequence Number

The sequence number of a characteristic or group of related characteristics within the same Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId].The sequence number is mandatory if there are multiple characteristics of the same type within the same Inventory_Product_ID [InvPrdctId].
Inventory Product Characteristics Characteristic UOM Code Measurement Unit
Code of measurement of the value of the product characteristic, if applicable. Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table. EXAMPLE PERC, KG
Characteristics Product Inventory Start Date
Start date from which the product characteristic value became valid.
Characteristics Product Inventory Start Time
Start time on the start date from which the product characteristic value became valid.
Characteristics Product Inventory End Date
End date until which the product characteristic value was valid.
Characteristics Product Inventory End Time
End time on the end date until which the product characteristic value was valid.
Characteristics Product Inventory Characteristic Value

The value of the product characteristic on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code according to the Standard Characteristics table (to be developped). For example:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- L in case of low-rated VAT product.
Characteristics Product Inventory System Characteristic Value

The value of the product characteristic as recorded in the source system of the organization to be audited, on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. For example- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- 1 in case of low-rated VAT product.
Inventory Transaction Characteristics
Contains inventory product characteristic information at the moment of the transaction. For example the alcohol percentage.
Inventory Transaction Characteristics Transaction Document ID Inventory Transaction

The unique identifier for the picking ticket, shipping notice, or other document created upon or associated with movement. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Transaction_Document_ID [TrDocId] in the INV_Transaction [InvTr] table.
Inventory Transaction Characteristics Transaction Document Line ID Inventory Transaction

The unique identifier for the line number for a document other than a customer order, or supplier purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Transaction_Document_Line_ID [TrDocLnId] related to the Transaction_Document_ID [TrDocId] in the INV_Transaction [InvTr] table.
Characteristics Transaction Inventory Characteristic Type

Standardized type of characteristic of the product in the transaction. The permitted values of Characteristic_Type [CharTyp] should be determined by mutual agreement between the auditor and the auditee.EXAMPLE NL_VATSTATUS, EU_COMCODE, GEN_ALCPERC
Characteristics Transaction Inventory Characteristic Sequence Number

The sequence number of a characteristic or group of related characteristics within the same Transaction_Document_ID [TrDocId] and Transaction_Document_Line_ID [TrDocLnId] combination.The sequence number is mandatory if there are multiple characteristics of the same type within the same Transaction_Document_ID [TrDocId] and Transaction_Document_Line_ID [TrDocLnId] combination.
Inventory Transaction Characteristics Characteristic UOM Code Measurement Unit
The standardized code of measurement of the value of the transaction characteristic, if applicable. Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table. EXAMPLE PERC, KG
Characteristics Transaction Inventory Characteristic Value

The value of the product characteristic on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code according to the Standard Characteristics table (to be developped). For example:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- L in case of low-rated VAT product.
Characteristics Transaction Inventory System Characteristic Value

The value of the product characteristic as recorded in the source system of the organization to be audited, on basis of the Characteristic UOM Code. For example:- 0.125 in case of alcohol percentage of 12,5 of wine,- 1 in case of low-rated VAT product.
Inventory Transaction Associated Document

Inventory Transaction Associated Document. Contains reference information of a document which is associated with the inventory transaction. One referential document could contain information about one or more transactions, but one transaction may never appear on more then one referential document of the same type. For example, a customs declaration form.
Inventory Transaction Associated Document Transaction Document ID Inventory Transaction

The unique identifier for the picking ticket, shipping notice, or other document created upon or associated with movement. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Transaction_Document_ID [TrDocId] in the INV_Transaction [InvTr] table.
Inventory Transaction Associated Document Transaction Document Line ID Inventory Transaction

The unique identifier for the line number for a document other than a customer order, or supplier purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Transaction_Document_Line_ID [TrDocLnId] related to the Transaction_Document_ID [TrDocId] in the INV_Transaction [InvTr] table.
Document Associated Inventory Transaction Submitted System
The identifier of the system in which the document / declaration is submitted.
Associated Transaction Inventory Document Code
The code of the transaction associated referential document. To be agreed with the auditee. For example Customs Declaration Form.
Associated Transaction Inventory Document ID
The ID of the transaction associated referential document. For example the number of the customs declaration form.
Associated Transaction Inventory Document Line ID
The line ID of a line on the transaction associated referential document. For example the line number on the customs declaration form.
GRFR Report Header
GRFR Report Header contains data with unique attributes.
Header GRFR Report ID
Unique Report ID. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Header GRFR Report Name
Name of the report.
Header GRFR Report Description
Free-form description of the entire individual report as described by the report header.
GRFR Report Header Reporting Entity Code Business Segment
Unique reporting entity code.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Header Report GRFR Reporting Entity Name
Name of the reporting entity.Shall match the Business_Segment_Name [BusSgNm] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
GRFR Report Header Fiscal Year Accounting Period

Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Header Report GRFR Reporting Period Type
Reporting period type is used to identify the span of time of the report. EXAMPLE: monthly, quarterly, annually.
Header Report GRFR Reporting Period BEG Date
Calendar beginning date of the report. EXAMPLE YYYY-MM-DD.
Header Report GRFR Reporting Period END Date
Calendar ending date of the report. EXAMPLE YYYY-MM-DD.
GRFR Report Header Reporting Currency Code Currency
Code for the currency (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match Currency_Code [CurCd] in BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Header Report GRFR Reporting Language Code
Reporting language code.
Header Report GRFR Regulations
Accounting rules or regulations name that the report complies with.
Header Report GRFR Person In Charge Of Enterprise
Name of the person who is in charge of the enterprise.
Header Report GRFR Accounting Supervisor
Name of the accounting supervisor who is in charge of the report submission.
Header Report GRFR Created By
Name of the person or user who created the report.
GRFR Report Body
GRFR Report Body contains detailed report information.
GRFR Report Body Report ID GRFR Report Header
Unique identifier for the report. Shall match the Report_ID [RepId] in theReport_Header table.
Body GRFR Report Item ID
Unique report item ID. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Body GRFR Report Item Name
Name of the report item.
Body GRFR Report Item Description
Free-form description of the individual reporting item.
Body GRFR Report Item Line Number
Report item line number.
Body GRFR Report Item Qualification
Report item qualification.EXAMPLE For semi-annual report 2020H1, current period is current year 2020H1, previous period is previous year 2019H1, last period is 2019H2.
Body GRFR Report Item Value
Report item amount.
Body GRFR Report Item Value Type
Value type for report item. EXAMPLE "balance" for the items of balance sheet or "amount" for the items of income statements.
Payslip Bank Name
Bank name of the employee's bank accounts,Full name of the institution (e.g. bank, financial institution, settlement centre).
Payslip Detail

The PAY_Payslip_Detail [PayPayslipDetail] contains the detailed information of each payslip, including all payroll items involved in each payslip (such as related payroll detail ID, associated payroll item code, whether to pay taxes and amounts, etc.). This table is the row level of payroll details.
Detail Payslip Line Number
Number of the payslip line. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Payslip Detail Payroll Item ID Payroll Item
Unique identifier for the payroll item. Shall match Payroll_Item_ID [PayrollItemId] in BAS_Payroll_Item.
Detail Payslip Payroll Item Code
The code of payroll item. Shall match the Payroll_Item_Code [PayrollItemCd] in the PAY_Payroll_Item [PayPayrollItem] table.
Detail Payslip Payroll Item Name
The name of payroll item. Shall match the Payroll_Item_Name [PayrollItemNm] in the PAY_Payroll_Item [PayPayrollItem] table.
Detail Payslip Payroll Category
The categories are defined depending on the different types of employees and different payment time. Shall match the Payroll_Category [PayrollCatg] in the PAY_Payroll_Item [PayPayrollItem] table.
Detail Payslip Payroll Item Value
The value of the payroll item. This can be text, amount, date etc.
Payslip Detail GL Account Number Chart Of Accounts
Number of the GL account. Shall match GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts].
